meanings.definition: A horizontal structural member in a roof.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully installed the purline across the roof.
meanings.sent2: The purline supports the weight of the roof tiles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the purline as a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: The purline stretched like a sturdy bridge over the attic space.
meanings.sent5: The purline, like a silent guardian, held up the roof above.

meanings.definition: To construct or provide with purlins.
meanings.sent1: The workers will purline the new building with strong beams.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to purline the structure before adding the roofing material.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to purline the barn with extra care to ensure durability.
meanings.sent4: She will purline the shed with precision and expertise.
meanings.sent5: Purlining the house will make it more resilient against harsh weather.
